text: Now, prepositions in Spanish won't come at the end of the sentence as they can in English.

text: We discussed the concept before about working backwards.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So, instead of building up to say what we want to say, finding bits of language and working backwards to find the true form of a verb.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So, for example, imagine we looked up somewhere United States or we asked somebody how to say United States and we came across Estados Unidos.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: We can use Unidos to work backwards to work out what is the verb to unite.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: How do you think that is?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Unidar.
speaker: Speaker 2

text: Not guessing, but really working backwards, which instead of building up, building down, instead of adding bits onto the verb, seeing what has been added and consciously taking it off.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So, ido has been added.
speaker: Speaker 2

text: When you add ido, you take off the ending of the true form.
speaker: Speaker 2

text: And what is the ending with ido?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Ir.

text: Or?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Er.

text: You should experiment and see which one feels more natural to you.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Now, the one that you may have heard before is probably going to feel more natural, even if you didn't register it.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So, if you heard before the correct version, it's going to feel more natural.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And also, the more words you learn in Spanish, the greater intuition you get about the phonetics of Spanish, what sounds more Spanish.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So, that should direct you when you say unir to understand which one is to unite.

text: Which one do you think it is?

text: Somehow, I think it's unir.

text: But at this stage, there's no reason for you to know what sounds more Spanish.

text: This intuition is something that occurs with practice and exposure and listening.

text: But working backwards is a useful skill that we want to employ in our language learning journey.
